meanings.definition: A person who causes intense emotional pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: She was known as one of the heartbreakers in school because she broke many hearts.
meanings.sent2: The movie portrayed the character as a heartbreaker who left a trail of broken hearts behind.
meanings.sent3: The heartbreakers in the romantic comedy turned out to be the mischievous twins causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The villain in the story was a heartbreaker, crushing the hopes and dreams of the protagonist.
meanings.sent5: The heartbreakers in the novel were so convincing that readers felt the characters' pain.

meanings.definition: Something that causes great disappointment or sorrow.
meanings.sent1: The cancellation of the concert was a real heartbreaker for the fans.
meanings.sent2: Losing the championship game was a heartbreaker for the team.
meanings.sent3: The heartbreakers of the party were the deflated balloons that ruined the decorations.
meanings.sent4: The storm's destruction was a heartbreaker for the small town.
meanings.sent5: The broken promise was a heartbreaker, leaving her feeling betrayed.
